intro: Acosta pannosa, commonly known as the woolly acosta, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy, often grayish foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
